intro: Nothopegia beddomei var. beddomei, commonly known as the Beddome's nothopegia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spurred flowers and fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. It is a rare and endemic species, with limited distribution and conservation concerns. Its unique morphology and ecological significance make it an important subject of botanical study.
